events.event: Bank panic creates momentum for central banking reform
Secret Jekyll Island meeting - Aldrich, Warburg, Vanderlip, Davison design Federal Reserve structure
Federal Reserve Act signed into law by Woodrow Wilson (Christmas week passage)
Great Depression - Fed criticized for monetary policy failures, bank failures
Bretton Woods system establishes dollar as global reserve currency (Fed benefits)
Nixon ends gold standard - Fed gains unlimited money creation capability
Federal Reserve Reform Act establishes dual mandate (price stability + maximum employment)
Alan Greenspan chairmanship - close Wall Street ties, deregulation advocacy
Financial crisis - Fed provides $16+ trillion in emergency loans to banks (concealed until 2011)
Bloomberg lawsuit forces disclosure of emergency lending recipients
Quantitative Easing programs (QE1, QE2, QE3) - trillions in asset purchases
Ron Paul's 'Audit the Fed' bills repeatedly blocked despite public support
COVID-19 response - unlimited QE, direct corporate bond purchases, $4+ trillion balance sheet expansion
